name: image-parse-chevereto

1.0.1.name: image-parse-chevereto
1.0.1.description: A Markdown tool to upload image to a chevereto server

cheveretoUploadOnParse.title: Chevereto Upload On Parse
cheveretoUploadOnParse.description: If checked, parse a image into md file will start upload process.

cheveretoImageSize.title: Chevereto Image Size
cheveretoImageSize.description: Which size of the image to use after successfully upload. default for 'url', medium for 'medium -> url'。

cheveretoApiKey.title: Chevereto Api Key
cheveretoApiKey.description: Input your api key, you can find it in your dashboard, default is my key ,Do not mark sure always available.

localImageSave.title: Local Image Save
localImageSave.description: If checked, the images will alse be saved in a subfolder when you parse a image into md file, otherwise, image will be saved in subfolder .tmp and will be remove after upload.

localSubfolderName.title: Local Subfolder Name
localSubfolderName.description: Subfolder name for images, set to empty will use the same name of your md file, eg: md file name xxxx.md, subfolder name xxxx.

localImageAutoremove.title: Local Image Autoremove
localImageAutoremove.description: If checked, images in subfolder (set in 'Local Subfolder Name') will be removed automaticlly after upload. Notes that images not in subfolder will not be moved in any case

readme:
# image-parse-chevereto package

## Descpriction
A Markdown tool to translate a image from clipboard into `Markdown form` (eg. `![](.tmp/test.jpg)`), save image into subfolder you set and upload to Chevereto server, and then replace `Markdown form` text with image url (eg. `![](https://yourdomain.net/images/2ee22496bc1c5594227cbb6100549916.png)`)

## Support file types
`Screenshoot` or `jpg` `png` files from clipboard.

## Support OS
`Windows` and `MacOS`

## How to use
> Building...
<!-- --->
> See if you can figure it out by yourself :)
